H0.text: Dragon boat racing, as part of a complex of ceremonies, is thought to have originated where. Vietnam

H1.text: Dragon boat racing, as part of a complex of ceremonies, is thought to have originated where. Japan

H2.text: Dragon boat racing, as part of a complex of ceremonies, is thought to have originated where. Korea

H3.text: Dragon boat racing, as part of a complex of ceremonies, is thought to have originated where. 中国

A4.text: Dragon boat racing has a rich history of ancient ceremonial and ritualistic traditions, which originated in southern central China more than 2500 years ago.

A5.text: The Dragon Boat Festival (traditional Chinese: 端午節; simplified Chinese: 端午节; pinyin: Duānwǔ jié; Cantonese Yale: Dyūnńgh jit) is a traditional Chinese holiday that occurs on the fifth day of the fifth month of the Chinese calendar, which corresponds to late May or early June in the Gregorian calendar.
